definitions.definition: the main part of something; most of something

examples.text: The bulk of the population lives in cities.
The great bulk of the work has now been done.

definitions.definition: the (large) size or quantity of something

examples.text: Despite its bulk and weight, the car is extremely fast.
a **bulk order** *(= one for a large number of similar items)*
**bulk buying** *(= buying in large amounts, often at a reduced price)*
It's cheaper to buy in bulk.
I was amazed by the sheer bulk of the creature.
Sugar is imported in bulk from the mainland.
A charge of £2.50 per copy is made for bulk orders.

definitions.definition: the weight or shape of somebody/something large

examples.text: She heaved her bulk out of the chair.
the looming dark bulk of the cathedral

wordOrigin: Middle English: the senses ‘cargo as a whole’ and ‘heap, large quantity’ (the earliest recorded) are probably from Old Norse búlki ‘cargo’; other senses arose perhaps by alteration of obsolete bouk ‘belly, body’.
